summary: The Equity in Government Act aims to improve the equitable provision of government services to underserved communities and individuals. It amends titles 5, 31, and 44 of the United States Code, requiring agencies to incorporate equity goals into strategic and performance plans. Key provisions include establishing an Agency Equity Advisory Team, an Equity Subcommittee of the Performance Improvement Council, and prioritizing equitable data collection and use. The bill also defines "underserved communities" and "underserved individuals" and directs the Comptroller General to evaluate the effectiveness of these measures.
